resources.string: In order to register for a study, Futto requires access to some this device\'s telephone services. Please press \"Allow\" when you see a menu requesting permissions to access SMS. Depending on the details of the study, you are allowed to disable this permission in the Futto app\'s preferences after registration is complete.

Futto requires SMS permissions in order to register for a study, but you appear to have denied it permission. We are going to bump you to the Futto app\'s settings so that you can manually enable SMS access.
This permission prompt you are about to see is required to allow Futto to execute in the background.

In order for Futto to initiate a phone call, you must go to Settings -> Permissions and grant the Futto app the \'Phone\' permission.\n\nOr, you can open the Phone app and make the phone call yourself.
If you are reading this, something broke. Please contact the study administrators, and tell them that there is a bug in the survey!
This device does not meet minimum specifications for this app, to avoid any issues resulting from this please uninstall the app.
Received an invalid encryption key, please contact the a Futto administrator.
Someone misconfigured the server! Please contact research staff.
This device could not be registered under the provided patient ID; please contact research staff.
Sorry: either your Study URL, your User ID, or your Temporary Password is incorrect.
Sorry, your Current Password is incorrect.
Sorry, your Temporary Password is incorrect.
Sorry, this User ID already has a phone registered. Please contact the research staff and ask them to clear your registration so that you can register this new phone.
It looks like you\'re not connected to the internet- please connect to the internet and try again.
Are you sure the URL for the study is correct? Futto can\'t connect to the server.

Thank you for completing the survey. A clinician will not see your answers immediately, so if you need help or are thinking about harming yourself, please contact your clinician. You can also press the \"Call My Clinician\" button.
There has been an error; your answers may not have been recorded and saved
Downloading the most up-to-date survey questions from the server...
User ID does not match the one in the system. Try again
Incorrect user ID and password combination
New Password doesn\'t match Confirm New Password.
Your new password must be at least %d characters long.
Call the research assistant to get a temporary password
Call the research assistant to get a temporary password. Your ID is \"%s\".
Your ID is \"%s\"; please identify yourself by that ID and not by your name.
Temporary password (the one the research assistant gave you)
Please enter the Temporary Password you were given at signup.
Please enter the URL for the study.

We would like to know how your day is going. When you are ready, please press \"Record\" and speak for about 2 minutes. Press \"Stop\" when you are finished. The recording will stop automatically after 4 minutes. Remember, researchers will not review and analyze your data until the end of the study, so if you are ill or in danger and need to speak with your clinician, press the \"Call My Clinician\" button.
"The voice recording can't be longer than "
" minutes, so your recording was automatically stopped and saved"

Futto is an application that runs on your cell phone and helps researchers collect information about your health and behaviors. It asks you to fill out short surveys, and to make a recording of your voice, once a day. Futto continuously collects information about your location (using your phone's GPS) and how much you move around (using your phone's accelerometer). It also monitors how much you use your phone for calling and texting, and it keeps track of the different people you communicate with. Importantly, Futto does not record the names or phone numbers of anyone you communicate with. While it can tell if you call the same person more than once, it does not know who that person is. Futto does not record the content of your text messages or phone calls. It also keeps track of the different Wi-Fi networks in your area, but the names of those networks are replaced with random codes. Finally, Futto can tell if you are near another phone that is also running this application.

Although Futto collects a large amount of data, all of this data is processed to protect your privacy. This means that the application does not know your name, your phone number, or anything else that could identify you. Futto only knows you by an identification number. Because Futto does not know who you are, it cannot communicate with your clinician if you are ill or in danger. Researchers will not review the data Futto collects until the end of the study. To make it easier for you to connect with your clinician, the "Call my Clinician" button appears at the top of every page. In order for the button to work, you must enter your clinician's phone number into Futto. You can change it as often as needed.

Futto was conceived and designed by Dr. Jukka-Pekka "JP" Onnela at the Harvard School of Public Health. The research study in which you are enrolled is run by Dr. Roy Perlis at Massachusetts General Hospital. The software was built by Zagaran, Inc., in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
"Phone numbers must be exactly %d digits long."
You must enter values for the two phone numbers above

You have indicated you do not consent to the terms of this application. If you press "I understand" the app will exit, and you will not be enrolled in the study. If you press "Cancel" the app will not exit and you will be able to press the "I Consent" button, which will then enroll you in the study.
You don\'t have new message now.
